dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Aida Balaeva, the Minister of Culture and Information in Kazakhstan, just addressed this issue head-on at a government briefing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Aida Balaeva, the Minister of Culture and Information in Kazakhstan, just addressed this issue head-on at a government briefing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Minister of Culture and Information Aida Balaeva responded to a question regarding the possible blocking of social media platforms in Kazakhstan amid the recent appearance of provocative posts and advertisements. During a government briefing, journalists asked Balaeva why the Ministry of Culture and Information is not reacting to advertisements on social networks that call on citizens of the CIS and Kazakhstan to sign contracts for participation in military actions in Ukraine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, she was asked about those provocative ads on social media, right? The ones recruiting for military action in Ukraine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, she was asked about those provocative ads on social media, right? The ones recruiting for military action in Ukraine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During a government briefing, journalists asked Balaeva why the Ministry of Culture and Information is not reacting to advertisements on social networks that call on citizens of the CIS and Kazakhstan to sign contracts for participation in military actions in Ukraine.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And she pushed back on the idea that her ministry isn't reacting. She said, um, they're actively identifying that content.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And she pushed back on the idea that her ministry isn't reacting. She said, um, they're actively identifying that content.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the minister, the ministry is actively working to identify such content. "I can't say we're not reacting, because, as you know, the volume of disinformation and illegal content is very large.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But she did acknowledge the sheer volume of it— like, the disinformation and illegal posts are just massive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But she did acknowledge the sheer volume of it- like, the disinformation and illegal posts are just massive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "I can't say we're not reacting, because, as you know, the volume of disinformation and illegal content is very large.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and she mentioned they send each case individually to the social media admins, who usually remove them pretty quickly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and she mentioned they send each case individually to the social media admins, who usually remove them pretty quickly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We send them for review individually, and in most cases, the administrators of social networks promptly remove them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then there's the other side— she pointed out that opponents and, uh, irresponsible citizens keep spreading them systematically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then there's the other side- she pointed out that opponents and, uh, irresponsible citizens keep spreading them systematically.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But another issue is that these posts are also systematically and constantly spread by our opponents and certain irresponsible citizens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So it's like a constant game of whack-a-mole. You take one down, two more pop up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's like a constant game of whack-a-mole. You take one down, two more pop up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then came the big question— will Kazakhstan actually block social networks over this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then came the big question- will Kazakhstan actually block social networks over this?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The minister also addressed the question of whether social networks would be blocked in Kazakhstan due to such posts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: She didn't rule it out completely, but she shifted focus to user responsibility. Said it's not just about platform admins or the government.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: She didn't rule it out completely, but she shifted focus to user responsibility. Said it's not just about platform admins or the government.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What I want to emphasize is that this does not depend solely on the administrators of these platforms or the actions of government agencies. First and foremost, it concerns the users themselves, who must understand their responsibility " they are directly accountable for maintaining societal stability and preventing the spread of false information.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, she really emphasized that users themselves have to understand their role in maintaining stability and not spreading false info.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, she really emphasized that users themselves have to understand their role in maintaining stability and not spreading false info.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: First and foremost, it concerns the users themselves, who must understand their responsibility " they are directly accountable for maintaining societal stability and preventing the spread of false information.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And she made it clear— if you break the law, you will be held accountable. No ambiguity there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And she made it clear- if you break the law, you will be held accountable. No ambiguity there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Those who break the law and are identified will, of course, be held legally accountable," added Aida Balaeva.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though— stopping short of outright blocking, and putting more onus on public awareness and legal consequences.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though- stopping short of outright blocking, and putting more onus on public awareness and legal consequences.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It sounds like a balancing act between control and, uh, public education.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It sounds like a balancing act between control and, uh, public education.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And with disinformation being such a flood, you can see why it's a tough position to be in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And with disinformation being such a flood, you can see why it's a tough position to be in.
